intro: Galium charoides, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically oval to lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium charoides is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local insect populations.
